meanings.definition: Strong thread or string consisting of two or more strands twisted together.
meanings.sent1: I used twine to tie up the package securely.
meanings.sent2: The farmer used twine to support the growing plants in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the twine, unraveling it all over the room.
meanings.sent4: The twine of fate binds us all together in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent5: The twine was so strong, it could hold even the heaviest objects in place.

meanings.sent1: She likes to twine her hair into a braid for school.
meanings.sent2: The vines twine around the tree trunk, creating a natural pattern.
meanings.sent3: The dancers twine gracefully around each other in the performance.
meanings.sent4: Their destinies twine together like the branches of a tree in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The melody and lyrics twine perfectly in this beautiful song.
